prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
solution: In Pascal's triangle, the $k^\text{th}$ element in the row $n$ has the value $\binom{n}{k-1}.$ Row $15$ starts with $\binom{15}{0},$ $\binom{15}{1},$ $\binom{15}{2},$ $\binom{15}{3},$ so the fourth element is $$\binom{15}{3}=\frac{15!}{3!(15-3)!}=\frac{15\cdot14\cdot13}{3\cdot2\cdot1}=5\cdot7\cdot13=\boxed{455}.$$
gpt_response:
To find the 4th element in Row 15, we need to look at Row 14. The 4th element in Row 14 is 91 (see the diagram below). So, the 4th element in Row 15 of Pascal's triangle would be 91 as well!

Row 14:
1 14 91 364 1001 2002 3003 3432 3003 2002 1001 364 91 14 1
